info.title: RIB-MOB Server API specification
info.description:
The API specification for RIB-MOB Server.

Set of functionalities covered.

TAGS         | Brief Description
------------ | -----------------------------
security     | operations related to authentication, mfa, soft tokens, soft login
registration | operations related to user registration on retail platform
accounts     | operations related to accounts
transfers    | operations related to transafers
quick pay    | operations related to quick pay 
sadad        | operations related to sadad ":" bill payment, moi, sadad account, prempyment, one time payment
cards        | operations related to cards ":" mada cards, credit cards, travel cards, shopping cards
loans-investments        | operations related to loans and investiments ":" loans, ipo subscriptions, shares
my-ebank     | miscellanea operations to manage user settings and services settings
loyalty      | operations related to loyalty program
others       | miscellanea operations
staticData   | operations related to static data as country list, national codes, banks
labels   | operations related to labels, languages and translations


Also the application follows the Standard Crealogix CODE infrastructure for REST applications



<details>
  <summary> __Change List__ </summary>
  
  |Version | date       | area        | description |
  |--------|------------|-------------|----------------------------------------------------------------------- |
  |1.0.0   | 2019/11/18 | ALL         | initial swagger definition  |
  |1.0.x   | 20120/xx/xx| XXXXX       | xxxxxxxxxxx                 |
  


</details>

|Version  | area     | description|
|---------|----------|------------|
|1.0.0    | Retail Mobile    | first version |

Error.description: Object error container. Concrete codes (values) will appear on ErrorDetails.

code.description:
one of the values accepted on enum related
* error: indicates a error before processing the call (preconditions and validations)
* mwexception: indicates an error fired for the 3party services (backEnd)
* exception: indicates an unexpected error processing the call or the response

currency.description: currency
Currency of the transaction (3 letters ISO code).

historyTotal.description: History aggregates. Dates are sorted with the oldest first.

lastTransactionDate.description: Date of the most recent transaction, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

TotalCategory.description: Sum of transaction amounts for a given category.

count.description: Number of transactions matching that category.

history.description: History aggregates. Dates are sorted with the oldest first.

creation.description: Creation date for this tip, format is ISO-8601: `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ`.

family.description: A free text description of a family or group the tip belongs to. It can typically be used by a client service to influence the way the tip's title should be presented to the user (e.g. with a particular icon, in a specific color, etc.).

hashtag.description: Hashtag associated to the tip for this transaction. Used only in the case of promoted hashtags inserted into transactions' custom descriptions.

height.description: Height in pixels of the window to show the tip's content in its entirety, with no scrollbar.

origin.description: `recommendation` when the origin of the tip is a recommendation, `campaign` when the origin of the tip is a campaign.

status.description: Status of the `recommendation` or `campaign` from which the tip originates, possible values are `live` or `paused` or `retired` or `expired`.

runningFrom.description: Start date of the `recommendation` or `campaign` from which the tip originates, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

runningTo.description: End date of the `recommendation` or `campaign` from which the tip originates, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

latencyMode.description: Latency mode of the recommendation for this tip, either `none` or `event` or `days`. The latency is used to control the minimum time between two generations of this recommendation for a given user. 'None' means that it will be shown whenever the conditions are met. The two other options force the engine to wait either a number of days or a particular event.

latencyEvent.description: Latency event of the recommendation for this tip, either `end_of_week` or `end_of_month` or `end_of_year`.

latencyDays.description: Latency days of the recommendation for this tip.

events.description: Events previously triggered by the user and recorded for this tip. An empty array is returned when no event occured.

data.description: Raw json data as generated by the tip.
data.example: "data": "{ \"amt\": 100, \"ccy\": \"SGD\", \"desc\": \"NETS ZARA\", \"body\": \"Did you know that you have been a big spender this month?\" }"

timestamp.description: Date and time of the event, format is ISO-8601: `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ`.

value.description: Event value when action is `custom` or `feedback`.

type.description: `customer` when the target of the tip is a customer, `account` when the target of the tip is an account, `statement` when the target of the tip is a statement, `none` when the tip is not persisted.

key.description: Key of the target object. Present only when the target is `account` or `statement`.

category.description: Merchant category as defined in the application.

pattern_type.description: Pattern type defined for the merchant. Valid values are `literal` or `regexp`.

pattern_value.description: Pattern value for the defined pattern type.

type.description: Type of the cashback offer. Possible values are `none`, `value` or `percentage`.

currency.description: Currency of the cashback offer when the type is `value` or `percentage`.

value.description: Value of the cashback offer when the type is `value` or `percentage`.

minimumPurchaseAmount.description: Minimum purchase amount, if defined for the cashback offer.

maximumPurchaseAmount.description: Maximum purchase amount, if defined for the cashback offer.

oneTimePurchase.description: Boolean field to indicate if this cashback offer is valid for one time purchase only

TipCampaign.title: TipCampaign
TipCampaign.description: Tip details when the origin is a campaign

merchant.description: The identifier of the predefined merchant or an empty string.

title.description: The title of the campaign as shown to the customer.

body.description: The content of the main message.
body.example: "body": "This is a special offer from Giant..."

image.description: Base64 representation of the image associated to the campaign, `'data:image/png;base64,...'`

maxActivations.description: If given, the maximum number of user activations allowed for this campaign.

PeriodicTotalsByCurrency.title: PeriodicTotalsByCurrency
PeriodicTotalsByCurrency.description: Periodic transaction totals of the same currency

currency.description: Currency of the transaction (3 letters ISO code).

historyDebit.description: Periodic debit aggregates. Dates are sorted with the oldest first.

historyCredit.description: Periodic credit aggregates. Dates are sorted with the oldest first.

currency.description: Currency of the transaction (3 letters ISO code).

amount.description: Absolute value of the transaction amount.

date.description: Value date of the transaction, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

balance.description: Running balance of the transaction's account.

originalCategory.description: Original category automatically assigned to that transaction if any.

extraction.description: Date and time of the extraction of the transaction, format is ISO-8601: `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ`.

authorization.description: Date and time of the authorization of the transaction, format is ISO-8601: `yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sssZ`.

status.description: Status of the transaction, `pre-authorized`, `authorized`, `posted`, `forecasted`, `deleted`, `rejected` or `cancelled`. Transaction is considered `posted` when no status is provided.

tips.description: Visible tips attached to this transaction. A tip is not visible anymore when its source (Campaign or Recommendation) is retired or expired and the customer never activated this tip. Tips are sorted by highest priority first.

customFields.description: Optional custom fields of the transaction.

lineItems.description: Optional line items of the transaction.

name.description: Name of the custom field. The predefined and reserved name `custom_description` is dedicated to store the free text description ideally initialized by the categorization engine and subsequently edited by the customer. It includes any hashtag associated to the current transaction to reflect its category.

value.description: Value of the field. Either a string or a boolean or a number or `null`. When the value is `null`, the field is deleted provided the immutable flag is not set to `true`. The custom field can contain any complementary information related to the transaction. A common example is an image of a receipt or the goods being purchased. The value could then contain the Base64 string representation of that image as `'data:image/png;base64,...' When the field is `custom_description`, the maximum length is 100.

immutable.description: Set to `true` to indicate the field can only be stored once and never changed or deleted. When the field is `custom_description`, this field is ignored.

core.description: Set to `true` (default) to indicate the field is part of the core transactions details and should be returned by all APIs that return transaction details. When the field is `custom_description`, this field is ignored.

key.description: Unique key of the line item.

amount.description: Absolute value of the line item amount.

customFields.description: Optional custom fields of the line item.

GetTransactionDetails.title: GetTransactionDetails
GetTransactionDetails.description: Retrieve statement's custom fields, core and non core.

expandTip.description: Expand tip to inlude raw data: `true` or `false`.

lastOccurrence.description: Last occurrence of the transaction that contains this custom field value.

count.description: Number of occurrences of this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.

minDebitAmount.description: Minimum amount found for a debit transaction containing this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.

maxDebitAmount.description: Maximum amount found for a debit transaction containing this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.

minCreditAmount.description: Minimum amount found for a credit transaction containing this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.

maxCreditAmount.description: Maximum amount found for a credit transaction containing this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.

sum.description:
Consolidated sum of transactions containing this custom field value in the entire customer's transaction history.
Since this is the net sum of credit and debit transactions, the resulting value could be negative.

value.description: Value of the field. Either a string or a boolean or a number or `null`. When the value is `null`, the field is deleted.

currency.description: Currency of the transaction (3 letters ISO code).

balances.description: Array of date of the balance in YYYY-MM-DD format followed by its value. Dates are sorted with the newest first.

TransactionsWithHistoryByCurrency.title: TransactionsWithHistoryByCurrency
TransactionsWithHistoryByCurrency.description: Set of same currency transactions with history aggregates

currency.description: Currency of the transactions (3 letters ISO code).

transactions.description: Array of transactions, sorted with the newest first.

history.description: History aggregates. Dates are sorted with the oldest first.

date.description: Date of the upcoming transactions, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

transactions.description: Array of tentative upcoming transactions, sorted in chronological order (earliest first).

key.description: Key of the ad-hoc upcoming transaction if any.

currency.description: Currency of the transaction (3 letters ISO code).

amount.description: Absolute value of the transaction amount.

frequency.description: Optional frequency in days of an ad-hoc upcoming transaction.

endDate.description: Optional end date when a frequency is set, format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

status.description: `forecasted` when the transaction status is forecasted.

customFields.description: Optional custom fields of the transaction.

SynchronizeCustomFields.title: SynchronizeCustomFields
SynchronizeCustomFields.description: Synchronize statement's custom fields. If a field already exists and the new value is `null`, the field is deleted. If no field is provided for an existing one, it is left unchanged in the database.

key.description: Key of the transaction to update.

custom_fields.description: Optional custom fields of the transaction.

mode.description: Mode of the update to perform when similar transactions' custom fields need to be updated like the current one. In the absence of this property, only the current transaction is updated.

SynchronizeCustomFieldsMode.title: SynchronizeCustomFieldsMode
SynchronizeCustomFieldsMode.description: Mode of custom fields synchronization for similar statements.

type.description:
Indicate how to update similar transactions:
`'update_similar'` updates similar transactions' custom fields if they don't already exist.
`'override_similar'` always updates transactions' custom fields whether they exist or not.

scope.description:
Scope of the update of similar transactions:
`'account'` to limit the update to the similar transactions of the account of the transaction being updated.
`'customer'` (default) to update all similar transactions of all customer's accounts.

currency.description: Currency of the amount to track under this budget.

amount.description: Amount to track under this budget.

direction.description: `'expense'` if this budget tracks an amount supposed to be below a given number (e.g. clothing expenses, rent paid to landlord, utility bill) or `'income'` if it tracks a minimum amount expected to be received under a given category (e.g. health insurance reimbursement, rent from tenant).

accountType.description: Type of account of the statements that participate to the budget.

accounts.description: List of comma separated account keys of the statements that participate to the budget.

searchQuery.description: Search query that contains tokens separated by spaces. A token starting with the `#` character identifies a category. Search for transactions where categories or sub categories exist in custom description or tokens exist in description or custom description. Search is case insensitive. Returns a transaction when at least one search category (if any) matches and one token matches.

startDate.description: The day when the frequence above will start. Format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

startOfWeek.description: Indicates the first day of the week, `'monday'`, `'tuesday'`, `'wednesday'`, `'thursday'`, `'friday'`, `'saturday'`, `'sunday'`. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'weekly'` or `'fortnightly'`.

startOfMonth.description: Indicates the first day of the month. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'monthly'`. Default is `1`.

threshold.description: Indicates the percentage of the amount of transactions related to that budget from which to notify the customer.

image.description: Optional image to associate to the budget.

shared.description: Optional value, present if the budget is shared.

customers.description: Array of customer names who are contributors to this budget. The first entry is the primary owner of the budget who created it and the rest are contributors enabled through the `shared` property of the budget.

value.description: Value of the field. Either a string or a boolean or a number or `null`. When the value is `null`, the field is deleted.

currency.description: Currency of the amount to track under this budget.

amount.description: Amount to track under this budget.

direction.description: `'expense'` if this budget tracks an amount supposed to be below a given number (e.g. clothing expenses, rent paid to landlord, utility bill) or `'income'` if it tracks a minimum amount expected to be received under a given category (e.g. health insurance reimbursement, rent from tenant).

accountType.description: Type of account of the statements that participate to the budget.

accounts.description: List of comma separated account keys of the statements that participate to the budget.

searchQuery.description: Search query using keywords separated by a space or the logical operators `AND`, `OR`, `NOT()`. A space is equivalent to `OR`. Single or double quotes search for an exact value. A keyword starting with `#` identifies a category and results include matching transactions for that category or one of its children if any. A keyword containing `:` search for the custom field `name:value`. An empty value means any value. Search expressions can be grouped using `()`. Search is case insensitive.

startDate.description: The day when the frequence above will start. Format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

startOfWeek.description: Indicates the first day of the week, `'monday'`, `'tuesday'`, `'wednesday'`, `'thursday'`, `'friday'`, `'saturday'`, `'sunday'`. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'weekly'` or `'fortnightly'`.

startOfMonth.description: Indicates the first day of the month. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'monthly'`. Default is `1`.

threshold.description: Indicates the percentage of the amount of transactions related to that budget from which to notify the customer.

image.description: Optional image to associate to the budget.

shared.description: Optional value, set it to `true` if the budget is visible to multiple customers. If this option is enabled, then the `accounts` field is mandatory and must contain exactly one account key. The budget is then visible to all customers who have access to this account. Setting this value without a single entry in the `accounts` parameter will result in an error.

currency.description: Currency of the amount to track under this budget.

amount.description: Amount to track under this budget.

threshold.description: Indicates the percentage of the amount of transactions related to that budget from which to notify the customer.

startDate.description: The day when the frequence above will start. Format is: `YYYY-MM-DD`.

startOfWeek.description: Indicates the first day of the week, `'monday'`, `'tuesday'`, `'wednesday'`, `'thursday'`, `'friday'`, `'saturday'`, `'sunday'`. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'weekly'` or `'fortnightly'`.

startOfMonth.description: Indicates the first day of the month. Only relevant when `frequency` is `'monthly'`. Default is `1`.

shared.description: Optional value, set it to `true` if the budget should be shared with multiple customers. If this option is enabled, the budget is shared with all customers that have access to the account the budget is linked with. Trying to enable this option when the budget was not created to track a single account (specified through the `accounts` property in the create budget request) will result in an error. All customers who have visiblity to this budget will have the ability to disable the shared option. If the sharing is disabled by one of the co-contributors, it becomes disabled for all the co-contributors and is visible only to the primary customer who created the budget. Only the primary owner of the budget will be able to re-enable the sharing option.

post.description:
URL that allow execute the oauth2 grant_types __mfa_pw__, __mfa_otp__ and __refresh_token__
This endpoint must be called two times at login time for =>
 * validate username and passwords. 
   Parameters =>  Authorization, Content-Type grant_type(__mfa_pw__), username, password
   Response pre_auth_token + OTP business data (otpSize,a uthenticationType ...)
 * validate mfa to complete authentication. 
   Parameters =>  Authorization, grant_type __mfa_otp__ , pre_auth_token (returned in first call), codeOTP
   Response OauthTokenResponse
 
Also must be used to refresh the oauth token

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Authorization: Basic Base64(clientId:secret) Ex => Authorization: Basic Y2xpZW50SWQ6c2VjcmV0

parameters.name: refresh_token
parameters.description: last refresh_token received value, only required if grant_type is "refresh_token"

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: the username encrypted with publick key to be identified required when grant_type has value '2FA'

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: the password of the username encrypeted with public key

parameters.name: cohid
parameters.description: public key fetched from the server. This tells the server which pair public/private key was used for encryption

parameters.name: pre_auth_token
parameters.description: prea oauth token retrieved in previus authentication call to oauth

parameters.name: nativeVersion
parameters.description: Business parameter, native application version for enforce upgrade

parameters.name: initialPage
parameters.description: Business parameter, request for the landing page from login. Used for quick login.

parameters.name: codeOTP
parameters.description: Business parameter, 2FA value could be SMS or soft token

parameters.name: accessKey
parameters.description: Required for soft_token grant type. This Access Key identifies the user (Fingerprint or Face ID). It must be encrypted using the rest/publicKey.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Required for soft_token grant type. This parameter is generated at the registration flow.

get.description:
There are multiple endpoints current RIB to get accounts. This unique endpoint tries to unify all them by adding query params. This is the combination of calls: /private/v1/accounts?refresh={refresh}
  (rib-rest) => /secure/accounts/list/{refresh} 
    => returns all accounts. 
    refresh=false => returns cached accounts
    refresh=true => clear the cache and fetch the accounts again from middleware

/private/v1/accounts?type=transactional 
  (rib-rest) => /secure/accounts/listTx
    => return all transactional accounts 

/private/v1/accounts?type=sar&olp={olp}   
  (rib-rest) => /secure/accounts/listSarTx?olp={olp} => returns sar and transactional accounts. Optionally it returns sadad olp account too.

/private/v1/accounts?refresh=true&type=sar
  (rib-rest) => /secure/accounts/listSarRefreshTx/{refresh} 
    => returns sar and transactional accounts

/private/v1/accounts?type=credited
 (rib-rest) =>  /secure/accounts/listCredit
  
    
(rib-rest) => /secure/accounts/listCurrencyTx/{currency} => not used

parameters.name: type
parameters.description:
filter accounts by type:
 * all - all accounts
 * sar - sar currency accounts
 * transactional - accounts eligeble for a transaction like transfer etc.
 * credited - accounts to be credited for operations like own account transfer, sadad olp fund out etc

parameters.name: refresh
parameters.description: clear the cache and fetch the accounts again from middleware

parameters.name: olp
parameters.description: true or false . Only used with type=sar, which returns sar and transactional accounts. Optionally it returns sadad olp account too.

X-CSRF-TOKEN.description: X-CSRF-TOKEN to use on next POST / PUT /PATCH / DELETE operation

post.description:
Bank customers can enrol to retail online banking system using customer personal data and debit card data :   
 * Customer account number.        
 * Customer National/ Iqama Id 
 * Last 6 digits of customer mada Debit Card
 * mada Debit Card PIN
All this data is sent encrypted to the server with the public key
